19namespace internal {
20namespace compiler {
21
22CommonOperatorReducer::CommonOperatorReducer(
23 Editor* editor, Graph* graph, JSHeapBroker* broker,
24 CommonOperatorBuilder* common, MachineOperatorBuilder* machine,
25 Zone* temp_zone, BranchSemantics default_branch_semantics)
26 : AdvancedReducer(editor),
27 graph_(graph),
28 broker_(broker),
29 common_(common),
30 machine_(machine),
31 dead_(graph->NewNode(common->Dead())),
32 zone_(temp_zone),
33 default_branch_semantics_(default_branch_semantics) {
34 NodeProperties::SetType(dead_, Type::None());
35}
36
37Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::Reduce(Node* node) {
38 DisallowHeapAccessIf no_heap_access(broker() == nullptr);
39 switch (node->opcode()) {
40 case IrOpcode::kBranch:
41 return ReduceBranch(node);
42 case IrOpcode::kDeoptimizeIf:
43 case IrOpcode::kDeoptimizeUnless:
44 return ReduceDeoptimizeConditional(node);
45 case IrOpcode::kMerge:
46 return ReduceMerge(node);
47 case IrOpcode::kEffectPhi:
48 return ReduceEffectPhi(node);
49 case IrOpcode::kPhi:
50 return ReducePhi(node);
51 case IrOpcode::kReturn:
52 return ReduceReturn(node);
53 case IrOpcode::kSelect:
54 return ReduceSelect(node);
55 case IrOpcode::kSwitch:
56 return ReduceSwitch(node);
57 case IrOpcode::kStaticAssert:
58 return ReduceStaticAssert(node);
59 case IrOpcode::kTrapIf:
60 case IrOpcode::kTrapUnless:
61 return ReduceTrapConditional(node);
62 default:
63 break;
64 }
65 return NoChange();
66}
67
68Decision CommonOperatorReducer::DecideCondition(
69 Node* const cond, BranchSemantics branch_semantics) {
70 Node* unwrapped = SkipValueIdentities(cond);
71 switch (unwrapped->opcode()) {
72 case IrOpcode::kInt32Constant: {
73 DCHECK_EQ(branch_semantics, BranchSemantics::kMachine);
74 Int32Matcher m(unwrapped);
75 return m.ResolvedValue() ? Decision::kTrue : Decision::kFalse;
76 }
77 case IrOpcode::kHeapConstant: {
78 if (branch_semantics == BranchSemantics::kMachine) {
79 return Decision::kTrue;
80 }
81 HeapObjectMatcher m(unwrapped);
82 base::Optional<bool> maybe_result =
83 m.Ref(broker_).TryGetBooleanValue(broker());
84 if (!maybe_result.has_value()) return Decision::kUnknown;
85 return *maybe_result ? Decision::kTrue : Decision::kFalse;
86 }
87 default:
88 return Decision::kUnknown;
89 }
90}
91
92Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceBranch(Node* node) {
93 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kBranch, node->opcode());
94 BranchSemantics branch_semantics = BranchSemanticsOf(node);
95 Node* const cond = node->InputAt(0);
96 // Swap IfTrue/IfFalse on {branch} if {cond} is a BooleanNot and use the input
97 // to BooleanNot as new condition for {branch}. Note we assume that {cond} was
98 // already properly optimized before we get here (as guaranteed by the graph
99 // reduction logic). The same applies if {cond} is a Select acting as boolean
100 // not (i.e. true being returned in the false case and vice versa).
101 if (cond->opcode() == IrOpcode::kBooleanNot ||
102 (cond->opcode() == IrOpcode::kSelect &&
103 DecideCondition(cond->InputAt(1), branch_semantics) ==
104 Decision::kFalse &&
105 DecideCondition(cond->InputAt(2), branch_semantics) ==
106 Decision::kTrue)) {
107 for (Node* const use : node->uses()) {
108 switch (use->opcode()) {
109 case IrOpcode::kIfTrue:
110 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(use, common()->IfFalse());
111 break;
112 case IrOpcode::kIfFalse:
113 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(use, common()->IfTrue());
114 break;
115 default:
116 UNREACHABLE();
117 }
118 }
119 // Update the condition of {branch}. No need to mark the uses for revisit,
120 // since we tell the graph reducer that the {branch} was changed and the
121 // graph reduction logic will ensure that the uses are revisited properly.
122 node->ReplaceInput(0, cond->InputAt(0));
123 // Negate the hint for {branch}.
124 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(
125 node, common()->Branch(NegateBranchHint(BranchHintOf(node->op()))));
126 return Changed(node);
127 }
128 Decision const decision = DecideCondition(cond, branch_semantics);
129 if (decision == Decision::kUnknown) return NoChange();
130 Node* const control = node->InputAt(1);
131 for (Node* const use : node->uses()) {
132 switch (use->opcode()) {
133 case IrOpcode::kIfTrue:
134 Replace(use, (decision == Decision::kTrue) ? control : dead());
135 break;
136 case IrOpcode::kIfFalse:
137 Replace(use, (decision == Decision::kFalse) ? control : dead());
138 break;
139 default:
140 UNREACHABLE();
141 }
142 }
143 return Replace(dead());
144}
145
146Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceDeoptimizeConditional(Node* node) {
147 DCHECK(node->opcode() == IrOpcode::kDeoptimizeIf ||
148 node->opcode() == IrOpcode::kDeoptimizeUnless);
149 bool condition_is_true = node->opcode() == IrOpcode::kDeoptimizeUnless;
150 DeoptimizeParameters p = DeoptimizeParametersOf(node->op());
151 Node* condition = NodeProperties::GetValueInput(node, 0);
152 Node* frame_state = NodeProperties::GetValueInput(node, 1);
153 Node* effect = NodeProperties::GetEffectInput(node);
154 Node* control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
155 // Swap DeoptimizeIf/DeoptimizeUnless on {node} if {cond} is a BooleaNot
156 // and use the input to BooleanNot as new condition for {node}. Note we
157 // assume that {cond} was already properly optimized before we get here
158 // (as guaranteed by the graph reduction logic).
159 if (condition->opcode() == IrOpcode::kBooleanNot) {
160 NodeProperties::ReplaceValueInput(node, condition->InputAt(0), 0);
161 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(
162 node, condition_is_true
163 ? common()->DeoptimizeIf(p.reason(), p.feedback())
164 : common()->DeoptimizeUnless(p.reason(), p.feedback()));
165 return Changed(node);
166 }
167 Decision const decision =
168 DecideCondition(condition, default_branch_semantics_);
169 if (decision == Decision::kUnknown) return NoChange();
170 if (condition_is_true == (decision == Decision::kTrue)) {
171 ReplaceWithValue(node, dead(), effect, control);
172 } else {
173 control = graph()->NewNode(common()->Deoptimize(p.reason(), p.feedback()),
174 frame_state, effect, control);
175 MergeControlToEnd(graph(), common(), control);
176 }
177 return Replace(dead());
178}
179
180Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceMerge(Node* node) {
181 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kMerge, node->opcode());
182 //
183 // Check if this is a merge that belongs to an unused diamond, which means
184 // that:
185 //
186 // a) the {Merge} has no {Phi} or {EffectPhi} uses, and
187 // b) the {Merge} has two inputs, one {IfTrue} and one {IfFalse}, which are
188 // both owned by the Merge, and
189 // c) and the {IfTrue} and {IfFalse} nodes point to the same {Branch}.
190 //
191 if (node->InputCount() == 2) {
192 for (Node* const use : node->uses()) {
193 if (IrOpcode::IsPhiOpcode(use->opcode())) return NoChange();
194 }
195 Node* if_true = node->InputAt(0);
196 Node* if_false = node->InputAt(1);
197 if (if_true->opcode() != IrOpcode::kIfTrue) std::swap(if_true, if_false);
198 if (if_true->opcode() == IrOpcode::kIfTrue &&
199 if_false->opcode() == IrOpcode::kIfFalse &&
200 if_true->InputAt(0) == if_false->InputAt(0) && if_true->OwnedBy(node) &&
201 if_false->OwnedBy(node)) {
202 Node* const branch = if_true->InputAt(0);
203 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kBranch, branch->opcode());
204 DCHECK(branch->OwnedBy(if_true, if_false));
205 Node* const control = branch->InputAt(1);
206 // Mark the {branch} as {Dead}.
207 branch->TrimInputCount(0);
208 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(branch, common()->Dead());
209 return Replace(control);
210 }
211 }
212 return NoChange();
213}
214
215
216Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceEffectPhi(Node* node) {
217 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kEffectPhi, node->opcode());
218 Node::Inputs inputs = node->inputs();
219 int const effect_input_count = inputs.count() - 1;
220 DCHECK_LE(1, effect_input_count);
221 Node* const merge = inputs[effect_input_count];
222 DCHECK(IrOpcode::IsMergeOpcode(merge->opcode()));
223 DCHECK_EQ(effect_input_count, merge->InputCount());
224 Node* const effect = inputs[0];
225 DCHECK_NE(node, effect);
226 for (int i = 1; i < effect_input_count; ++i) {
227 Node* const input = inputs[i];
228 if (input == node) {
229 // Ignore redundant inputs.
230 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kLoop, merge->opcode());
231 continue;
232 }
233 if (input != effect) return NoChange();
234 }
235 // We might now be able to further reduce the {merge} node.
236 Revisit(merge);
237 return Replace(effect);
238}
239
240
241Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReducePhi(Node* node) {
242 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kPhi, node->opcode());
243 Node::Inputs inputs = node->inputs();
244 int const value_input_count = inputs.count() - 1;
245 DCHECK_LE(1, value_input_count);
246 Node* const merge = inputs[value_input_count];
247 DCHECK(IrOpcode::IsMergeOpcode(merge->opcode()));
248 DCHECK_EQ(value_input_count, merge->InputCount());
249 if (value_input_count == 2) {
250 // The following optimization tries to match `0 < v ? v : 0 - v`, which
251 // corresponds in Turbofan to something like:
252 //
253 // Branch(0 < v)
254 // / \
255 // / \
256 // v 0 - v
257 // \ /
258 // \ /
259 // phi(v, 0-v)
260 //
261 // And replace it by `fabs(v)`.
262 // TODO(dmercadier): it seems that these optimizations never kick in. While
263 // keeping them doesn't cost too much, we could consider removing them to
264 // simplify the code and not maintain unused pieces of code.
265 Node* vtrue = inputs[0];
266 Node* vfalse = inputs[1];
267 Node::Inputs merge_inputs = merge->inputs();
268 Node* if_true = merge_inputs[0];
269 Node* if_false = merge_inputs[1];
270 if (if_true->opcode() != IrOpcode::kIfTrue) {
271 std::swap(if_true, if_false);
272 std::swap(vtrue, vfalse);
273 }
274 if (if_true->opcode() == IrOpcode::kIfTrue &&
275 if_false->opcode() == IrOpcode::kIfFalse &&
276 if_true->InputAt(0) == if_false->InputAt(0)) {
277 Node* const branch = if_true->InputAt(0);
278 // Check that the branch is not dead already.
279 if (branch->opcode() != IrOpcode::kBranch) return NoChange();
280 Node* const cond = branch->InputAt(0);
281 if (cond->opcode() == IrOpcode::kFloat32LessThan) {
282 Float32BinopMatcher mcond(cond);
283 if (mcond.left().Is(0.0) && mcond.right().Equals(vtrue) &&
284 vfalse->opcode() == IrOpcode::kFloat32Sub) {
285 Float32BinopMatcher mvfalse(vfalse);
286 if (mvfalse.left().IsZero() && mvfalse.right().Equals(vtrue)) {
287 // We might now be able to further reduce the {merge} node.
288 Revisit(merge);
289 return Change(node, machine()->Float32Abs(), vtrue);
290 }
291 }
292 } else if (cond->opcode() == IrOpcode::kFloat64LessThan) {
293 Float64BinopMatcher mcond(cond);
294 if (mcond.left().Is(0.0) && mcond.right().Equals(vtrue) &&
295 vfalse->opcode() == IrOpcode::kFloat64Sub) {
296 Float64BinopMatcher mvfalse(vfalse);
297 if (mvfalse.left().IsZero() && mvfalse.right().Equals(vtrue)) {
298 // We might now be able to further reduce the {merge} node.
299 Revisit(merge);
300 return Change(node, machine()->Float64Abs(), vtrue);
301 }
302 }
303 } else if (cond->opcode() == IrOpcode::kInt32LessThan) {
304 Int32BinopMatcher mcond(cond);
305 if (mcond.left().Is(0) && mcond.right().Equals(vtrue) &&
306 (vfalse->opcode() == IrOpcode::kInt32Sub)) {
307 Int32BinopMatcher mvfalse(vfalse);
308 if (mvfalse.left().Is(0) && mvfalse.right().Equals(vtrue)) {
309 // We might now be able to further reduce the {merge} node.
310 Revisit(merge);
311
312 if (machine()->Word32Select().IsSupported()) {
313 // Select positive value with conditional move if is supported.
314 Node* abs = graph()->NewNode(machine()->Word32Select().op(), cond,
315 vtrue, vfalse);
316 return Replace(abs);
317 } else {
318 // Generate absolute integer value.
319 //
320 // let sign = input >> 31 in
321 // (input ^ sign) - sign
322 Node* sign = graph()->NewNode(
323 machine()->Word32Sar(), vtrue,
324 graph()->NewNode(common()->Int32Constant(31)));
325 Node* abs = graph()->NewNode(
326 machine()->Int32Sub(),
327 graph()->NewNode(machine()->Word32Xor(), vtrue, sign), sign);
328 return Replace(abs);
329 }
330 }
331 }
332 }
333 }
334 }
335 Node* const value = inputs[0];
336 DCHECK_NE(node, value);
337 for (int i = 1; i < value_input_count; ++i) {
338 Node* const input = inputs[i];
339 if (input == node) {
340 // Ignore redundant inputs.
341 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kLoop, merge->opcode());
342 continue;
343 }
344 if (input != value) return NoChange();
345 }
346 // We might now be able to further reduce the {merge} node.
347 Revisit(merge);
348 return Replace(value);
349}
350
351Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceReturn(Node* node) {
352 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kReturn, node->opcode());
353 Node* effect = NodeProperties::GetEffectInput(node);
354 // TODO(mslekova): Port this to Turboshaft.
355 if (effect->opcode() == IrOpcode::kCheckpoint) {
356 // Any {Return} node can never be used to insert a deoptimization point,
357 // hence checkpoints can be cut out of the effect chain flowing into it.
358 effect = NodeProperties::GetEffectInput(effect);
359 NodeProperties::ReplaceEffectInput(node, effect);
360 return Changed(node).FollowedBy(ReduceReturn(node));
361 }
362 // TODO(ahaas): Extend the reduction below to multiple return values.
363 if (ValueInputCountOfReturn(node->op()) != 1) {
364 return NoChange();
365 }
366 Node* pop_count = NodeProperties::GetValueInput(node, 0);
367 Node* value = NodeProperties::GetValueInput(node, 1);
368 Node* control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(node);
369 if (value->opcode() == IrOpcode::kPhi &&
370 NodeProperties::GetControlInput(value) == control &&
371 control->opcode() == IrOpcode::kMerge) {
372 // This optimization pushes {Return} nodes through merges. It checks that
373 // the return value is actually a {Phi} and the return control dependency
374 // is the {Merge} to which the {Phi} belongs.
375
376 // Value1 ... ValueN Control1 ... ControlN
377 // ^ ^ ^ ^
378 // | | | |
379 // +----+-----+ +------+-----+
380 // | |
381 // Phi --------------> Merge
382 // ^ ^
383 // | |
384 // | +-----------------+
385 // | |
386 // Return -----> Effect
387 // ^
388 // |
389 // End
390
391 // Now the effect input to the {Return} node can be either an {EffectPhi}
392 // hanging off the same {Merge}, or the effect chain doesn't depend on the
393 // {Phi} or the {Merge}, in which case we know that the effect input must
394 // somehow dominate all merged branches.
395
396 Node::Inputs control_inputs = control->inputs();
397 Node::Inputs value_inputs = value->inputs();
398 DCHECK_NE(0, control_inputs.count());
399 DCHECK_EQ(control_inputs.count(), value_inputs.count() - 1);
400 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kEnd, graph()->end()->opcode());
401 DCHECK_NE(0, graph()->end()->InputCount());
402 if (control->OwnedBy(node, value) && value->OwnedBy(node)) {
403 for (int i = 0; i < control_inputs.count(); ++i) {
404 // Create a new {Return} and connect it to {end}. We don't need to mark
405 // {end} as revisit, because we mark {node} as {Dead} below, which was
406 // previously connected to {end}, so we know for sure that at some point
407 // the reducer logic will visit {end} again.
408 Node* ret = graph()->NewNode(node->op(), pop_count, value_inputs[i],
409 effect, control_inputs[i]);
410 MergeControlToEnd(graph(), common(), ret);
411 }
412 // Mark the Merge {control} and Return {node} as {dead}.
413 Replace(control, dead());
414 return Replace(dead());
415 } else if (effect->opcode() == IrOpcode::kEffectPhi &&
416 NodeProperties::GetControlInput(effect) == control) {
417 Node::Inputs effect_inputs = effect->inputs();
418 DCHECK_EQ(control_inputs.count(), effect_inputs.count() - 1);
419 for (int i = 0; i < control_inputs.count(); ++i) {
420 // Create a new {Return} and connect it to {end}. We don't need to mark
421 // {end} as revisit, because we mark {node} as {Dead} below, which was
422 // previously connected to {end}, so we know for sure that at some point
423 // the reducer logic will visit {end} again.
424 Node* ret = graph()->NewNode(node->op(), pop_count, value_inputs[i],
425 effect_inputs[i], control_inputs[i]);
426 MergeControlToEnd(graph(), common(), ret);
427 }
428 // Mark the Merge {control} and Return {node} as {dead}.
429 Replace(control, dead());
430 return Replace(dead());
431 }
432 }
433 return NoChange();
434}
435
436Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceSelect(Node* node) {
437 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kSelect, node->opcode());
438 Node* const cond = node->InputAt(0);
439 Node* const vtrue = node->InputAt(1);
440 Node* const vfalse = node->InputAt(2);
441 if (vtrue == vfalse) return Replace(vtrue);
442 switch (DecideCondition(cond, default_branch_semantics_)) {
443 case Decision::kTrue:
444 return Replace(vtrue);
445 case Decision::kFalse:
446 return Replace(vfalse);
447 case Decision::kUnknown:
448 break;
449 }
450 // The following optimization tries to replace `select(0 < v ? v : 0 - v)` by
451 // `fabs(v)`.
452 // TODO(dmercadier): it seems that these optimizations never kick in. While
453 // keeping them doesn't cost too much, we could consider removing them to
454 // simplify the code and not maintain unused pieces of code.
455 switch (cond->opcode()) {
456 case IrOpcode::kFloat32LessThan: {
457 Float32BinopMatcher mcond(cond);
458 if (mcond.left().Is(0.0) && mcond.right().Equals(vtrue) &&
459 vfalse->opcode() == IrOpcode::kFloat32Sub) {
460 Float32BinopMatcher mvfalse(vfalse);
461 if (mvfalse.left().IsZero() && mvfalse.right().Equals(vtrue)) {
462 return Change(node, machine()->Float32Abs(), vtrue);
463 }
464 }
465 break;
466 }
467 case IrOpcode::kFloat64LessThan: {
468 Float64BinopMatcher mcond(cond);
469 if (mcond.left().Is(0.0) && mcond.right().Equals(vtrue) &&
470 vfalse->opcode() == IrOpcode::kFloat64Sub) {
471 Float64BinopMatcher mvfalse(vfalse);
472 if (mvfalse.left().IsZero() && mvfalse.right().Equals(vtrue)) {
473 return Change(node, machine()->Float64Abs(), vtrue);
474 }
475 }
476 break;
477 }
478 default:
479 break;
480 }
481 return NoChange();
482}
483
484Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceSwitch(Node* node) {
485 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kSwitch, node->opcode());
486 Node* const switched_value = node->InputAt(0);
487 Node* const control = node->InputAt(1);
488
489 // Attempt to constant match the switched value against the IfValue cases. If
490 // no case matches, then use the IfDefault. We don't bother marking
491 // non-matching cases as dead code (same for an unused IfDefault), because the
492 // Switch itself will be marked as dead code.
493 Int32Matcher mswitched(switched_value);
494 if (mswitched.HasResolvedValue()) {
495 bool matched = false;
496
497 size_t const projection_count = node->op()->ControlOutputCount();
498 Node** projections = zone_->AllocateArray<Node*>(projection_count);
499 NodeProperties::CollectControlProjections(node, projections,
500 projection_count);
501 for (size_t i = 0; i < projection_count - 1; i++) {
502 Node* if_value = projections[i];
503 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kIfValue, if_value->opcode());
504 const IfValueParameters& p = IfValueParametersOf(if_value->op());
505 if (p.value() == mswitched.ResolvedValue()) {
506 matched = true;
507 Replace(if_value, control);
508 break;
509 }
510 }
511 if (!matched) {
512 Node* if_default = projections[projection_count - 1];
513 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kIfDefault, if_default->opcode());
514 Replace(if_default, control);
515 }
516 return Replace(dead());
517 }
518 return NoChange();
519}
520
521Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceStaticAssert(Node* node) {
522 DCHECK_EQ(IrOpcode::kStaticAssert, node->opcode());
523 Node* const cond = node->InputAt(0);
524 Decision decision = DecideCondition(cond, default_branch_semantics_);
525 if (decision == Decision::kTrue) {
526 RelaxEffectsAndControls(node);
527 return Changed(node);
528 } else {
529 return NoChange();
530 }
531}
532
533Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::ReduceTrapConditional(Node* trap) {
534 DCHECK(trap->opcode() == IrOpcode::kTrapIf ||
535 trap->opcode() == IrOpcode::kTrapUnless);
536 bool trapping_condition = trap->opcode() == IrOpcode::kTrapIf;
537 Node* const cond = trap->InputAt(0);
538 Decision decision = DecideCondition(cond, default_branch_semantics_);
539
540 if (decision == Decision::kUnknown) {
541 return NoChange();
542 } else if ((decision == Decision::kTrue) == trapping_condition) {
543 // This will always trap. Mark its outputs as dead and connect it to
544 // graph()->end().
545 ReplaceWithValue(trap, dead(), dead(), dead());
546 Node* control = graph()->NewNode(common()->Throw(), trap, trap);
547 MergeControlToEnd(graph(), common(), control);
548 return Changed(trap);
549 } else {
550 // This will not trap, remove it by relaxing effect/control.
551 Node* control = NodeProperties::GetControlInput(trap);
552 ReplaceWithValue(trap, dead());
553 trap->Kill();
554 // The argument below is irrelevant, picked {control} for debugging.
555 return Replace(control);
556 }
557}
558
559Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::Change(Node* node, Operator const* op,
560 Node* a) {
561 node->ReplaceInput(0, a);
562 node->TrimInputCount(1);
563 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(node, op);
564 return Changed(node);
565}
566
567
568Reduction CommonOperatorReducer::Change(Node* node, Operator const* op, Node* a,
569 Node* b) {
570 node->ReplaceInput(0, a);
571 node->ReplaceInput(1, b);
572 node->TrimInputCount(2);
573 NodeProperties::ChangeOp(node, op);
574 return Changed(node);
575}
